channel.title: 2006 Remake Xp rate?
channel.description: In your opinion what would be perfect xp rate for 2006 remake, why?

item.description:

200x

item.title: 2006 Remake Xp rate?
item.dc:creator: @Tcondren Tcondren
item.description:
@Tcondren wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:47, topic:543803”][quote author=Tcondren link=topic=662683.msg4435968#msg4435968 date=1405082479]

Or lets all just go play OSRS!

Get this: it wasn’t written by retards, it’s not hosted by someone who asks for money for dds’s and, AND, ITS THE REAL GAME WITH NO RISKS OF VIRUSES FROM RETARDED PEOPLE.

no brainer.

And yet the only reason it exists is because they got into deals that essentially forced them to ruin their game, company and profits compared to other MMOs and they needed more morphine to feed their actual game.
And it’s not ran by retards?
[/quote]

Mistakes can be made, making a large mistake does not make a retard. They pointed the game in the wrong direction in a lot of older players eyes, however, they still get a hell of a lot of players to this day, even with their new RS3 shit.

What your saying is an opinion that’s formed around being stuck in the past. They couldn’t leave the game stuck in 2004. Keeping with the times and following competitors patterns is what kept them alive for so long.[/quote]
Because coming up with your original idea is too much for an MMO, right?
I’m not stuck in the past, but it’s not like it’s hard to innovate in an MMO. Most barely differ from each other beyond subject and that’s what made the game stand out, being a little bit different, at least a little bit. not much though.

Who says they wouldn’t be here, though? They were doing amazingly until they made loads of stupid decisions, even bringing RS07 is stupid because it can’t thrive with a community as small as it is.

Read full topic

item.title: 2006 Remake Xp rate?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

If I’m right… The XP rate was 4xp per 1 damage. If you wanted to completely replicate it, which you would probably get more respect for, I’d keep everything the same. If you’re wanting to make this server online and playable, not many people are going to want to play a server with original XP rates. Up to you. But if someone wanted an extreme challenge with low xp rates, why not just go play OSRS?

Read full topic

The only BEST xp rate is x10.

Always fun. Never boring. Always challenging.

item.title: 2006 Remake Xp rate?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:30, topic:543803”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=662683.msg4434347#msg4434347 date=1404521972]
That is the reason why Jagex has such a low base rate lol. It’s an innate flaw to RSPS. If the uselessness of those armours bothers you, why not just adjust the level reqs to be a bit higher for each one?
[/quote]
Yes, because when they were first developing the level system and exp formula the first thing they thought of was “we should make these rates really slow so when someone copies our content it will be flawed for them for some apparent reason”.[/quote]
Please learn what innate means.

Start with the original modifier and make people pay ingame cash to increment the modifier?

item.title: 2006 Remake Xp rate?
item.dc:creator: @Tcondren Tcondren
item.description:
@Tcondren wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:24, topic:543803”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=662683.msg4433816#msg4433816 date=1404330602]

I’d prefer if it were dynamic and changes throughout levels. This means that the early game content isn’t made utterly useless after 4 clicks why ensuring the rate at which you level up isn’t too slow.

This, or at least if possible different rates per skill. The rate of fm compared to fishing or slayer is stupid.
[/quote]Both of these are bad ideas.

First of all, it’s already dyamic based on just the level. Early game content is useless even in the real game, you can usually get 10-20 in certain skills by doing quests or spending 20 minutes doing something. Changing that to 1-5 minutes isn’t a big deal.

Different skill rates is also dumb because some skills are supposed to be slower than others. If you change the XP rate you will fuck the economy up really hard, they are balanced for a reason. The only reasonable change would be combat stats being a higher xp rate together than skills (but you’d have to make sure for magic it only applies to combat spells, not all casting)[/quote]
The issue I’m referring to is that items that aren’t Rune or better are never used. What exactly is the point in leaving the tiered system of weapons as is if you go from Iron to Rune in a matter of a few hits?
When I first started playing the game, I remember having mith and addy for a long time. Of course, training pures made me make my training far more efficient since I also has loads of more time, but even then getting to Rune was an achievement.

That’s why I suggest a dynamic kind of xp system, at level one the rate could be as low as x1, and then increase at certain milestones. This means that all of the games items still have some kind of worth for a while rather than being flat out pointless without making people bored of them as it did in RS07.

I suppose one could argue that people are too lazy to work with lower experience rates, even at lower levels, but then you also have to question what the point of remaking Runescape is if most of it’s content will go amiss anyway.

Read full topic
